paragraph.content: authorize the Authority to investigate the ownership or control of voting shares in a licensee and for the purpose of such investigation may authorize the Authority to require any person to give particulars concerning any right, title or interest to or in any such voting shares that he may have and also particulars concerning the right, title or interest to or in those voting shares which to his knowledge any other person may have;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: authorize the Authority to require a licensee to supply such particulars as may be specified in the regulations concerning any right, title or interest of persons to or in its shares, including particulars of transfers of any such right, title or interest;

paragraph.name: c
d
paragraph.content: empower the Authority, where any person fails or refuses to supply particulars concerning any right, title or interest he may have to or in any such voting shares in accordance with the regulations, to suspend the voting rights attached to such shares;

paragraph.name: e
f
paragraph.content: prescribe the procedures to be followed in giving directions under section 13K(1);

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: regulate matters relating to transfers of rights, titles and interests to or in such voting shares. (Amended 17 of 2011 s. 28)

subsection.content: Regulations made under this section may provide that a contravention of specified provisions thereof shall be an offence punishable by a fine not exceeding level 6. (Amended E.R. 2 of 2012)

section.name: s13O
section.heading: Regulations relating to standards and technical requirements
section.leadIn: The Chief Executive in Council may make regulations for the purpose of— (Amended 4 of 2024 s. 5)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: establishing standards for the programmes and advertising material to be broadcast by licensees; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: providing for the technical requirements with which a licensee must comply in broadcasting. (Amended 4 of 2024 s. 9)

part.name: P4
part.heading: Use of Land for Telecommunications Lines, Etc.

section.name: s14
section.heading: Power to place and maintain telecommunications lines, etc., on land, etc.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority, and any licensee authorized by the Authority either generally or for any particular occasion, may place and maintain a telecommunications line, and such posts as may be necessary, in, over or upon any land or seabed and may enter upon the land or seabed for the purpose of site inspection, or other activities for or incidental to placement and maintenance of a telecommunications line, subject— (Amended 36 of 2000 ss. 8 & 28)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of unleased Government land or seabed, to the consent in writing of the Director of Lands or an officer of the Lands Department appointed by him for the purposes of this section; and (Amended L.N. 291 of 1993; 29 of 1998 s. 105; 36 of 2000 s. 8)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of land vested in or occupied by the Hong Kong Garrison, to the consent in writing of the Commander of the Hong Kong Garrison, or such officer as he appoints to be his representative for the purposes of this section. (Amended 2 of 2012 s. 3)

subsection.name: 1AA
subsection.leadIn: Despite any other law, a licensee authorized by the Authority either generally or for any particular occasion may do either or both of the following—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.leadIn: enter the specified building for the purpose of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: inspecting it; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: other activities that are for the purpose of, or incidental to, the placement and maintenance of the installation. (Added 4 of 2024 s. 3)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: Notwithstanding any other law, any licensee authorized by the Authority for any particular occasion may do either or both of the following— (Amended 4 of 2024 s. 3)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: place and maintain a radiocommunications installation in, over or upon any subsection (1A) land for the purpose of providing a radiocommunications service to a public place;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: enter any such land for the purpose of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: inspecting it; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: other activities which are for the purpose of or incidental to the placement and maintenance of the installation. (Added 36 of 2000 s. 8)

subsection.name: 1B
subsection.leadIn: The Authority must not grant an authorization referred to in subsection (1A)— (Amended 4 of 2024 s. 3)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: unless it is satisfied that the authorization is in the public interest; (Amended 17 of 2011 s. 28)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: except after taking into account—

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: whether or not there are technical alternatives to the installation;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: whether or not the utilization of the subsection (1A) land to which the authorization, if granted, will relate is critical for the supply of the service by the licensee seeking the authorization;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: whether or not that land has available capacity to be so utilized having regard to the current and reasonable future needs of the occupants of that land; and

subparagraph.name: v

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: unless it has given a reasonable opportunity to the persons having a lawful interest in the subsection (1A) land concerned and to the licensees concerned to make representations and has considered all representations made before it decides whether or not to grant the authorization; and (Amended 17 of 2011 s. 28)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: unless it— (Amended 17 of 2011 s. 28)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: gives reasons in writing for the grant of the authorization; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: specifies in writing the technical requirements, if any, of the right of access arising from the authorization. (Added 36 of 2000 s. 8)

subsection.name: 1C
subsection.content: Paragraph (a) of subsection (1) applies to subsection (1A) land as it applies to land referred to in subsection (1). (Added 36 of 2000 s. 8)

subsection.name: 1D
subsection.leadIn: Where subsection (1A) is applicable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Authority must, upon application made to it by the licensee or the person having a lawful interest in the subsection (1A) land concerned, specify in writing an interim fee (including the terms and conditions in accordance with which it is payable) to be paid by the licensee to the person; and (Amended 17 of 2011 s. 28)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the licensee must not exercise any rights conferred by the authorization referred to in that subsection on the licensee— (Amended 4 of 2024 s. 3)

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the licensee and the person having a lawful interest in the subsection (1A) land concerned come to an agreement referred to in subsection (5)(a);

subparagraph.name: B
C
subparagraph.content: the payment of the interim fee concerned to the person or, if the interim fee is to be paid in instalments, upon the payment of the first instalment of the interim fee to the person; or

subparagraph.name: D
subparagraph.content: such time as is agreed between the licensee and the person; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: except in compliance with any other conditions to which the authorization is subject. (Added 36 of 2000 s. 8)

subsection.leadIn: In exercising the powers conferred by subsection (1), (1AA) or (1A), as the case may be, the Authority or the licensee, as the case may be, must— (Amended 4 of 2024 s. 3)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: give reasonable notice to the owner of any land or seabed or to the person in control of any land or seabed of the Authority’s or licensee’s intention to enter upon that land or seabed; (Amended 17 of 2011 s. 28)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: do as little damage as possible,

subsection.continued: and—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: full compensation must be paid by the Authority, or the licensee, as the case may be, to any person having a lawful interest in the land or seabed, or being lawfully thereon, who suffers physical damage to any fixture or chattels found on the land or seabed as a result of the exercise of those powers;

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.leadIn: where subsection (1A) is applicable, a fee (which may be a once only fee or a monthly or annual fee) must be paid— (Amended 4 of 2024 s. 3)

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: which is fair and reasonable in all the circumstances of the case; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: by the licensee to any person having a lawful interest in the subsection (1A) land. (Replaced 36 of 2000 s. 8)

subsection.leadIn: So far as may be necessary for the due exercise of the powers conferred by subsection (1), (1AA) or (1A), as the case may be, the Authority or the licensee, as the case may be, may alter the position of any pipe or wire, other than a water, gas or electric main, if— (Amended 36 of 2000 s. 8; 4 of 2024 s. 3)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: reasonable notice has been given to the owner of the pipe or wire or the person in control thereof; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a pipe or wire in or over or upon unleased Government land or upon the seabed, the consent in writing of the Director of Lands or an officer of the Lands Department appointed by him for the purposes of this section has been obtained; and (Amended L.N. 291 of 1993; 29 of 1998 s. 105; 36 of 2000 s. 8)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in the case of a pipe or wire in, over or upon land vested in or occupied by the Hong Kong Garrison, the consent in writing of the Commander of the Hong Kong Garrison, or such officer as he appoints to be his representative for the purposes of this section has been obtained. (Amended 2 of 2012 s. 3)

subsection.content: The Authority, or a licensee authorized by the Authority under subsection (1), (1AA) or (1A), as the case may be, may apply to a magistrate for an order that a person must not prevent or obstruct the Authority or the licensee, as the case may be, from exercising the powers conferred by that subsection. (Added 36 of 2000 s. 8)

subsection.leadIn: Where subsection (1A) is applicable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the licensee and the person having a lawful interest in the subsection (1A) land concerned must endeavour to come to an agreement as to the fee to be paid under subsection (2)(ii) by the licensee to that person;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in the absence of any such agreement within a reasonable time, then—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the fee, and the terms and conditions in accordance with which it is payable, must be determined by arbitration under the Arbitration Ordinance (Cap. 609); and (Amended 17 of 2010 s. 112)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: for the purpose of subparagraph (i), the licensee and the person having a lawful interest in the subsection (1A) land concerned are to be regarded as having made an arbitration agreement within the meaning of that Ordinance the provisions of which agreement are to be deemed to include— (Amended 4 of 2024 s. 3)

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: a provision that the fee, and the terms and conditions in accordance with which it must be paid, must, in the absence of agreement, be determined by a single arbitrator; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: a provision equivalent to subsection (7). (Added 36 of 2000 s. 8)

subsection.leadIn: In any arbitration proceedings for the purposes of subsection (5)(b)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: regard must be given to— (Amended 4 of 2024 s. 3)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the principle that the fee to be paid must be fair and reasonable in all the circumstances of the case, including, but not limited to, factors relating to cost, property-value and the benefits to be derived from the authorization concerned referred to in subsection (1A);

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the guidelines issued by the Authority under section 6D(2)(b) on the application of the principle referred to in subparagraph (i) in any such proceedings; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the reasons and technical requirements concerned, if any, referred to in subsection (1B)(d);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: regard must not be given to the amount of any interim fee specified by virtue of the operation of subsection (1D). (Added 36 of 2000 s. 8)

subsection.leadIn: Where in any arbitration proceedings for the purposes of subsection (5)(b)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there is a dispute on a matter other than the technical requirements concerned, if any, referred to in subsection (1B)(d); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the arbitrator is of the opinion that, without determining that matter—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the licensee and the person concerned will not reach an agreement to give effect to the authorization concerned referred to in subsection (1A); or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the determination referred to in subsection (5)(b) cannot be made,

subsection.continued: then the arbitrator may determine that matter in any manner fair and reasonable in all the circumstances of the case and not inconsistent with the authorization concerned referred to in subsection (1A). (Added 36 of 2000 s. 8)

subsection.leadIn: In a determination referred to in subsection (5)(b), the arbitrator must— (Amended 4 of 2024 s. 3)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in specifying the fee to which the determination relates, include provisions for set-off in view of any interim fee paid by virtue of the operation of subsection (1D); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: specify that the fee to which it relates is payable for the period commencing on the first exercise of a right—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: conferred by the authorization concerned referred to in subsection (1A); and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: by the licensee concerned in relation to the subsection (1A) land concerned. (Added 36 of 2000 s. 8)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: The Authority may issue a certificate certifying that a licensee has the right of access under subsection (1), (1AA) or (1A) to the land or seabed specified in the certificate to place and maintain telecommunications lines, or a radiocommunications installation, as the case may be, in, over or upon the land or seabed.

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Where a person having an interest in the land or seabed specified in a certificate referred to in paragraph (a) does not allow the licensee concerned to gain access to the land or seabed for the purpose of placing and maintaining telecommunications lines, or a radiocommunications installation, as the case may be, in, over or upon the land or seabed, the licensee may apply to the court for an injunction. (Added 36 of 2000 s. 8)

subsection.def: In subsection (1), land (土地) does not include land for the exclusive occupation or use of any person whilst the land is being so occupied or used. (Added 36 of 2000 s. 8)

subsection.leadIn: In this section, a building is a specified building (指明建築物) if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the building is required to be provided with access facilities for telecommunications and broadcasting services under the Building (Planning) Regulations (Cap. 123 sub. leg. F); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: either one of the following subparagraphs applies to the building—

subparagraph.content: the earliest approval of any of the plans for the building works for the erection of the building is given for the purposes of section 14(1) of the Buildings Ordinance (Cap. 123) on or after the specified date;

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: not less than one-half (measured by volume) of the building is rebuilt; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the building is altered to such an extent as to necessitate the reconstruction of not less than one-half of the superficial area of the main walls,

subparagraph.continued: the earliest approval of any of the plans for the building works in connection with the rebuilding or alteration is given for the purposes of section 14(1) of the Buildings Ordinance (Cap. 123) on or after the specified date,

subsection.continued: but a specified building does not include a building, or any part of it, for the exclusive occupation or use of any person whilst the building or part is being so occupied or used. (Added 4 of 2024 s. 3)

subsection.leadIn: In this section ——
subsection.def: specified date (指明日期) means the day next following the expiry of a period of 6 months beginning on the commencement date* of section 3 of the Telecommunications (Amendment) Ordinance 2024 (4 of 2024);

def.name: Subsection1ALand
def.leadIn: subsection (1A) land (第(1A)款土地) means land that is neither of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a specified building;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: land for the exclusive occupation or use of any person whilst the land is being so occupied or used. (Added 4 of 2024 s. 3)

subsection.leadIn: For the avoidance of doubt, it is hereby declared that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a reference to land or seabed in subsection (2) or (9)—

subparagraph.content: in relation to a power conferred by, or a right of access under, subsection (1AA)—is a reference to a specified building; or
in relation to a power conferred by, or a right of access under, subsection (1A)—is a reference to subsection (1A) land; (Added 4 of 2024 s. 3)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where there is an inconsistency between any provision of a technical requirement referred to in subsection (1B)(d) and any provision, relating to public safety, of any other Ordinance, then the second-mentioned provision prevails over the first-mentioned provision to the extent of the inconsistency;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: compensation is not payable under subsection (2) in relation to any physical damage referred to in that subsection for which full compensation has been paid or is payable under any other provision of this Ordinance or under any other law. (Added 36 of 2000 s. 8)

section.sourceNote: (Amended L.N. 76 of 1982; L.N. 94 of 1986; 4 of 2024 s. 3)

subsection.leadIn: Where any dispute arises as to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whether compensation is payable under section 14(2);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the amount of any such compensation; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the person to whom it is payable,

subsection.continued: the dispute shall be referred to and determined by the District Court.

subsection.content: For the purposes of this section, a dispute shall be deemed to have arisen where a claimant or the Authority or the licensee, as the case may be, has served notice of intention to refer the dispute to the District Court upon all other parties to the dispute, and the party who has served notice as aforesaid shall, within 2 months thereafter, refer the dispute to the District Court by notice served upon a deputy registrar of the Court giving particulars of the matter in dispute between the parties, and a copy of the last-mentioned notice shall, within the said period, be served upon all other parties.

The District Court may order that the costs incurred by any party in proceedings before it under this section shall be paid by any other party, and may tax or settle the amount of any costs to be paid under any such order, or may direct the manner in which they are to be taxed.
The Chief Justice may, subject to this Ordinance, make rules for regulating proceedings before the District Court under this section.

section.name: s16
section.heading: Removal, etc., of line, post or installation where necessary by reason of use of land, etc.

subsection.content: Where any person desires to use land or seabed in a way that makes it necessary to remove to another part of the land or seabed a telecommunications line, post or radiocommunications installation maintained by the Authority or a licensee in, over or upon the land or seabed under section 14 or to alter such telecommunications line, post or radiocommunications installation in any way, he may by written notice served upon the Authority or licensee, as the case may be, require the removal or alteration of the telecommunications line, post or radiocommunications installation and such requirement shall not be unreasonably refused by the Authority or licensee, as the case may be. (Replaced 36 of 2000 s. 9)
Any expenses incurred by the Authority or the licensee in complying with a requirement under subsection (1) may be recovered from the person who made the requirement.

If a tree standing or lying near a telecommunications line or radiocommunications installation interrupts, or is likely to interrupt telecommunications, a magistrate may, upon application by the Authority or the licensee concerned, as the case may be, order the tree to be removed or otherwise dealt with in such a way as to prevent the interruption, or the likelihood of the interruption, of telecommunications and, if the tree was in existence at the time the telecommunications line or radiocommunications installation was placed in, over or upon the land, may order the Authority or the licensee, as the case may be, to pay to the owner of the tree such sum by way of compensation as he thinks reasonable. (Amended 36 of 2000 ss. 10 & 28)
Any order of a magistrate in proceedings under subsection (1) shall be final.

Any person who proposes to carry out on any land or seabed work that may affect a telecommunications line or radiocommunications installation maintained by the Authority or a licensee in, over, upon or near the land or seabed shall give to the Authority or the licensee, as the case may be, notice in writing of his intention to carry out the work.

All reasonable precautions shall be taken in the carrying out of such work to prevent damage to any telecommunications line or radiocommunications installation in, over, upon or near the land or seabed, and the Authority or the licensee, as the case may be, may recover from the person on whose behalf the work is carried out any expenses incurred in making good any damage to a telecommunications line or radiocommunications installation caused by a failure to take such precautions.

In any proceedings under subsection (2) for the recovery of the expenses incurred by the Authority or the licensee, it shall be presumed, until the contrary is proved, that the work was carried out on behalf of the owner of the land or seabed.

section.name: s18A
section.heading: Requirements relating to work near underground telecommunications lines

subsection.leadIn: A person must not carry out, or cause or permit another to carry out, any work below ground level near an underground telecommunications line, unless the person takes, before the work begins, all reasonable steps to ascertain—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whether any underground telecommunications line exists within or near the proposed work site; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if so—the alignment and depth of the line.

subsection.leadIn: If a person carries out, or causes or permits another to carry out, any work below ground level at a work site within which, or near which, an underground telecommunications line exists, the person must ensure that all reasonable measures are taken to prevent—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any damage to the line; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any interruption to a telecommunications service,

subsection.continued: arising from the work.

section.name: s19
section.heading: Power to enter on land, etc., to inspect, repair, etc., telecommunications lines, etc.
section.content: The Authority and a licensee may at such times as may be necessary enter upon any land or seabed in, over or upon which the Authority or licensee maintains a telecommunications line, post or radiocommunications installation for the purpose of inspecting, repairing, removing or altering the telecommunications line, post or radiocommunications installation.

subsection.def: In this Part and in section 29, land (土地) includes common parts as defined in section 2 of the Building Management Ordinance (Cap. 344). (Added 38 of 1993 s. 5. Amended 36 of 2000 s. 13)
In this Part seabed (海床) includes an estuary or arm of the sea or the shore or bed of any tidal waters within the boundaries of Hong Kong. (Added 36 of 2000 s. 13)

section.name: s19B
section.heading: Right of access to public telecommunications services

subsection.content: A term in a lease agreement, deed of mutual covenant or commercial contract that, in all the circumstances of the case, unreasonably restricts the right of a resident or occupier, or deprives a resident or occupier of the right, to have access to the public telecommunications services of his choice is void on and after the day on which this section comes into operation to the extent only that it imposes such restriction.
Subsection (1) shall apply to any agreement, deed or contract entered into before, on or after the day on which this section comes into operation*.

section.name: s20
section.heading: Contravention of section 8 an offence
section.leadIn: Any person who contravenes section 8(1) shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on summary conviction, to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 2 years; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment, to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 5 years.

section.name: s21
section.heading: Contravention of section 9 an offence
section.content: Any person who contravenes section 9 shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable on summary conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 12 months.

section.name: s22
section.heading: Penalty in event of contravention of section 10, 11 or 12
section.content: In the event of a contravention of section 10(1), 11(1) or 12, the master of the vessel or the captain of the aircraft, as the case may be, or the person at whose direction the radiocommunications apparatus was used, shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable on summary conviction to a fine at level 5.

subsection.content: A person who contravenes section 18A(1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: A person who contravenes section 18A(2) commits an offence and is liable on conviction—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the contravention results in an interruption to a telecommunications service—to a fine of $200,000 and to imprisonment for 12 months; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in any other case—to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 6 months,

subsection.continued: and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $10,000 for every day during which the offence continues.

subsection.leadIn: In proceedings against a person for an offence under subsection (1), it is for the person to show that the person took, before the work began, all reasonable steps to ascertain—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whether any underground telecommunications line existed at the time within or near the proposed work site; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if so—the alignment and depth of the line.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (3), if the person shows that the person complied with an operative guideline relating to taking reasonable steps as referred to in section 18A(1), the person is taken to have shown that the person took all reasonable steps.

In proceedings against a person for an offence under subsection (2), it is a defence for the person to show that the person complied with an operative guideline relating to taking reasonable measures as referred to in section 18A(2).

subsection.leadIn: Also, it is a defence for the person charged with an offence under subsection (2) to show that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person took, before the work began, all reasonable steps for the purposes of section 18A(1); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any failure to take all reasonable measures for the purposes of section 18A(2) was due to reliance on information provided by the licensee authorized to place and maintain the underground telecommunications line concerned.

section.name: s22B
section.heading: Use of guidelines in criminal proceedings under section 22A

subsection.content: This section applies in relation to criminal proceedings before a magistrate or a court in which a person is alleged to have committed an offence under section 22A(1) or (2).
A provision of an operative guideline that appears to the magistrate or the court to be relevant to the alleged offence is admissible in evidence in the proceedings.

subsection.leadIn: Also, if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a provision of the operative guideline appears to the magistrate or the court to be relevant to a matter that the prosecution must prove in order to establish the offence; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the prosecution has proved that the person failed to comply with the provision at the relevant time,

subsection.continued: the prosecution may rely on the failure as tending to prove the matter.

subsection.content: However, subsection (3) does not apply if the person shows that, for the matter referred to in subsection (3)(a), a requirement alleged to have been contravened was complied with other than by complying with the provision of the operative guideline.

section.name: s23
section.heading: Transmitting or receiving messages, etc., by unlicensed means of telecommunications
section.content: Any person who, knowing or having reason to believe that a means of telecommunications is being maintained in contravention of this Ordinance, transmits or receives any message by such means of telecommunications or performs any service incidental to the transmission or reception of any such message or delivers any message for transmission by such means of telecommunications or takes delivery of any message sent thereby shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable on summary conviction to a fine at level 5.

section.name: s23A
section.heading: Penalty for selling message received on sound broadcast receiving apparatus or a television receiver
section.leadIn: Any person who, without the consent of the Authority— (Amended E.R. 1 of 2019)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: sells; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: offers for sale; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: publishes or reproduces for reward,

section.continued: any message or information, or the sense or meaning of any message or information received by him or by any other person by means of a sound broadcast receiving apparatus or a television receiver shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable on summary conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months. (Amended E.R. 2 of 2012)
section.sourceNote: (Added 2 of 1968 s. 4. Amended 17 of 1972 s. 4; 18 of 1994 s. 6)

subsection.leadIn: A telecommunications officer, or any person who, though not a telecommunications officer, has official duties in connection with a telecommunications service, who— (Amended 36 of 2000 s. 28; 9 of 2007 s. 63)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: wilfully destroys, secretes or alters any message that he has received for transmission or delivery;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: forges any message or utters any message that he knows to be forged or altered;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: wilfully abstains from transmitting any message or wilfully intercepts or detains or delays any message;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: otherwise than in pursuance of his duty or as directed by a court, copies any message or discloses any message or the purport of any message to any person other than the person to whom the message is addressed,

subsection.continued: shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable on summary conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 2 years. (Amended 18 of 1994 s. 7; E.R. 2 of 2012)

subsection.leadIn: This section does not apply to any act done by a telecommunications officer, or any person who, though not a telecommunications officer, has official duties in connection with a telecommunications service, for the purpose of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: facilitating compliance with this Ordinance or the Unsolicited Electronic Messages Ordinance (Cap. 593);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: implementing the terms or conditions of a licence of a licensee or any contract made between a licensee and a customer of the licensee; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: facilitating compliance with a lawful request of a customer of a licensee in connection with a service supplied by the licensee to the customer. (Added 9 of 2007 s. 63)

section.name: s25
section.heading: Secretion, etc., of messages by persons other than telecommunications officers
section.leadIn: Any person, not being a telecommunications officer, or a person who, though not a telecommunications officer, has official duties in connection with a telecommunications service, who— (Amended 36 of 2000 s. 28)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: wilfully secretes, detains or delays a message intended for delivery to some other person; or (Amended 48 of 1972 s. 4)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: having been required by a telecommunications officer to deliver up to him a message in the possession of that person and intended for delivery to some other person, refuses or neglects to do so, (Amended 36 of 2000 s. 28)

section.continued: shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable on summary conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 12 months.

section.name: s26
section.heading: Transmission by telecommunications officer of message not paid for
section.content: A telecommunications officer who, with intent to defraud, transmits by telecommunications a message in respect of which the charge prescribed by or under this Ordinance has not been paid shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable on summary conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 2 years.

section.name: s27
section.heading: Damaging telecommunications installation with intent
section.leadIn: Any person who damages, removes or interferes in any way whatsoever with a telecommunications installation with intent to— (Amended 36 of 2000 s. 28)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: prevent or obstruct the transmission or delivery of a message; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: intercept or discover the contents of a message,

section.continued: shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable on summary conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 2 years.

section.name: s27A
section.heading: Unauthorized access to computer by telecommunications

subsection.content: Any person who, by telecommunications, knowingly causes a computer to perform any function to obtain unauthorized access to any program or data held in a computer commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4. (Amended 36 of 2000 s. 28; E.R. 2 of 2012)

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the intent of the person need not be directed at—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any particular program or data;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a program or data of a particular kind; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: a program or data held in a particular computer;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: access of any kind by a person to any program or data held in a computer is unauthorized if he is not entitled to control access of the kind in question to the program or data held in the computer and—

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: he does not believe that he has been so authorized; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: he does not believe that he would have been so authorized if he had applied for the appropriate authority.

subsection.content: Subsection (1) has effect without prejudice to any law relating to powers of inspection, search or seizure.

Notwithstanding section 26 of the Magistrates Ordinance (Cap. 227), proceedings for an offence under this section may be brought at any time within 3 years of the commission of the offence or within 6 months of the discovery of the offence by the prosecutor, whichever period expires first.

section.name: s28
section.heading: False or deceptive distress, etc., messages
section.leadIn: A person who transmits, or causes to be transmitted, by telecommunications a false distress, urgency, safety or identification signal— (Amended 36 of 2000 s. 28)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: knowing or believing it to be false; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: with intent to deceive,

section.continued: commits an offence and is liable on summary conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 2 years.

section.name: s29
section.heading: Entry on certain land without permission
section.content: Any person who, without lawful authority or excuse, enters or remains on any land in the occupation of a person who provides a telecommunications service shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable on summary conviction to a fine at level 2.

section.name: s30
section.heading: Penalty for contravention of order under section 33
section.content: Any person who fails to comply with an order under section 33 shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable on summary conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 12 months.

section.name: s31
section.heading: Obstruction of Authority, etc.
section.content: Any person who wilfully obstructs the Authority or any public officer in the exercise of any power conferred upon the Authority or public officer by this Ordinance shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable on summary conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s32
section.heading: Liability of directors, etc., where offence committed by corporation
section.content: Where a person by whom an offence under this Ordinance is committed is a corporation and it is proved that the offence was committed with the consent or connivance of a director or other officer concerned in the management of the corporation, the director or other officer shall be guilty of the like offence.

section.name: s32A
section.heading: Use of unauthorized frequencies
section.content: A licensee who possesses or uses a radio transmitter operating on a frequency, or installed at a location, not authorized under its licence commits an offence and shall be liable on conviction to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 2 years.

section.name: s32B
section.heading: Unauthorized dealing in radio transmitters
section.leadIn: A licensee authorized to deal in radio transmitters in the course of trade or business—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: who sells or offers to sell or delivers a radio transmitter to a person who is not licensed, or issued with a permit, or exempt from licensing, to possess or use that transmitter;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: who sells or offers to sell or delivers a radio transmitter the sale or delivery of which is prohibited under a condition of the licence; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: where the licence conditions provide that the sale or delivery of a particular class of radio transmitters shall be recorded in a transaction register in accordance with the licence conditions, who fails to make the record upon sale or delivery,

section.continued: commits an offence and shall be liable on conviction to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 2 years.

section.name: s32C
section.heading: Unauthorized modification of radio transmitters
section.content: A person who knowingly, and without lawful excuse, modifies, or causes to be modified, a radio transmitter that is licensed or authorized under a permit under this Ordinance so that the possession or use of the modified radio transmitter contravenes the licence or permit commits an offence and shall be liable on conviction to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 2 years.

section.name: s32CA
section.heading: Burden of proof
section.leadIn: A person is taken to have shown a matter that needs to be shown under section 22A(3), (4), (5) or (6) or 22B(4) if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there is sufficient evidence to raise an issue with respect to the matter; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the contrary is not proved by the prosecution beyond reasonable doubt.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may prescribe standards and specifications of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: telecommunications networks, systems, installations, customer equipment and services;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: other non-telecommunications equipment generating, deliberately or incidentally, radio frequency energy that may cause interference to telecommunications networks, systems, installations, customer equipment and services; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: other non-telecommunications equipment that may suffer interference from telecommunications networks, systems, installations, customer equipment and services,

subsection.continued: in pursuit of the following objectives—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: to prevent or reduce radio interference or the risk of interference to telecommunications networks, systems, installations, customer equipment and services;

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: to facilitate correct, efficient or reliable operation of telecommunications;

paragraph.name: iii
paragraph.content: to control the level of non-ionizing electromagnetic radiation that is allowed to be emitted by telecommunications apparatus; (Replaced 38 of 2021 s. 8)

paragraph.name: iv
paragraph.content: to ensure that equipment complies with international or recognized industrial standards in respect of telecommunications functions; (Amended 38 of 2021 s. 8)

paragraph.name: v
paragraph.content: to ensure the compatibility of the interfacing equipment between 2 or more interconnecting telecommunications networks, systems, installations, customer equipment or services;

paragraph.name: vi
paragraph.content: to ensure the interoperability of customer equipment with the telecommunications system to which it is connected;

paragraph.name: vii
paragraph.content: to ensure an acceptable quality of reception of telecommunications services;

paragraph.name: viii
paragraph.content: as a means to achieve the objectives of this Ordinance.

subsection.content: Without prejudice to the generality of section 6C, before prescribing the standards and specifications under subsection (1), the Authority shall carry out such consultation with the telecommunications industry as is reasonable in all the circumstances of the case.

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: test or require the testing of equipment or installations against prescribed specifications;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: determine the measuring apparatus to be used, the method by which and the conditions under which tests are to be made;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: issue certificates to certify that the equipment or installation complies with prescribed specifications if the Authority is satisfied that the equipment or installation complies with the specifications;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: prescribe the labels to be affixed to the equipment or installation to show that the equipment or installation complies with the prescribed specifications and to impose requirements for securing information to be marked on, to be given in advertisements or to accompany specified telecommunications equipment or a specified installation;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: by order prescribe that equipment or an installation shall not be offered for sale unless the equipment or installation complies with the prescribed specifications or bears the prescribed label;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: recover the actual costs incurred plus overhead from persons submitting equipment or installations for testing against the prescribed specifications;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: accredit other organizations or institutions for the purpose of carrying out the responsibilities set out in paragraphs (a) and (c).

section.name: s32F
section.heading: Power of Authority in relation to numbering plan

subsection.content: All powers and privileges relating to or connected with the numbering plan, including its ownership and control, are vested in the Authority.
The Authority shall promote the efficient and equitable allocation and use of numbers and codes in the numbering plan.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: prepare, specify, approve, publish, administer (including, in particular, allocate, assign, lease or sell the right to use a number or a code, a block or blocks of numbers or a block or blocks of codes), enforce and amend the numbering plan;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: issue codes of practice relating to the use of numbers and codes in the numbering plan, and any code so issued may include provisions relating to number portability;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: designate, or approve on request by any person, a number or a code, a block or blocks of numbers or a block or blocks of codes in the numbering plan to be the subject of special allocation, assignment, lease or sale as provided for under regulations made by the Secretary under subsection (5);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: recover the cost of administration of the numbering plan from the allocation, assignment, lease or sale of right to use numbers and codes in the numbering plan;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: delegate the administration of the numbering plan or a part of the numbering plan to any person.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may issue directions in writing to require a licensee or a person who is exempted from licensing under section 39 to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: submit information on the utilization of numbers and codes to which it has been allocated or assigned;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: adhere to the numbering plan; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: observe the codes of practice issued by the Authority under subsection (3)(b).

subsection.leadIn: The Secretary may by regulation—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: provide for—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the allocation, assignment, lease or sale, whether by auction, tender or for consideration, or otherwise of;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the amount of fees to be levied for,

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: require any proceeds arising out of any allocation, assignment, lease or sale referred to in paragraph (a), less the administrative costs of carrying out the allocation, assignment, lease or sale, to be—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: paid to a charitable institution or an institution carrying out education, or research and development, activities connected with telecommunications; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: applied towards promoting education, or research and development, connected with telecommunications; or

subparagraph.name: ii

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: impose requirements on the Authority in relation to the establishment and management of any such fund.

subsection.content: The amount of any fees prescribed under subsection (5) need not be limited by reference to the amount of administrative or other costs incurred or likely to be incurred in relation to the allocation, assignment, lease or sale of a number or code.

part.name: P5B
part.heading: Management of Radio Spectrum and Prevention of Interference

subsection.content: The Authority shall promote the efficient allocation and use of the radio spectrum as a public resource of Hong Kong.

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to the generality of section 6C, before exercising its powers under sections 32H(2)(a) and (b) and 32I(1), the Authority shall carry out such consultation with— (Amended 17 of 2011 s. 28)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the telecommunications industry; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: such other persons who may be directly affected by the exercise of such powers,

subsection.continued: as is reasonable in all the circumstances of the case.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may assign—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: frequencies and bands of frequencies in all parts of the radio spectrum used in Hong Kong or on board a ship, aircraft or space object that is registered or licensed in Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: satellite orbital positions and parameters for satellites registered or licensed in Hong Kong,

subsection.continued: and shall keep a central register of the frequencies, bands of frequencies and satellite orbital positions and parameters assigned.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to the consultation requirement under section 32G(2), divide any part of the radio spectrum into the number of bands of frequencies it thinks appropriate and specify the general purpose for which each band may be used;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subject to the consultation requirement under section 32G(2), divide a frequency band into the channels it considers appropriate and specify the general purpose for which each channel may be used;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: assign the frequencies or bands of frequencies to users of radiocommunications apparatus and specify the purpose for which and the conditions under which the frequencies or bands of frequencies are to be used.(Amended 17 of 2011 s. 28)

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (4), the Authority may vary or withdraw frequencies, bands of frequencies or satellite orbital positions or parameters assigned, or vary the purposes for which and the conditions under which the frequencies, bands of frequencies or satellite orbital positions or parameters are to be used.

The Authority may only exercise its authority under subsection (3) if the Authority has given reasonable notice of the intended variation or withdrawal to the licensee which has been assigned the relevant frequency, band of frequency or satellite orbital position or parameter.

A person shall not, in Hong Kong or on board any ship, aircraft or space object that is registered or licensed in Hong Kong, use a frequency in any part of the radio spectrum unless the frequency is assigned, or located within a band of frequencies assigned, by the Authority or the use is for the purpose and in compliance with the conditions specified by the Authority.

subsection.leadIn: Where an assignment which may be made under subsection (1) relates to the use of spectrum which under section 32I is subject to the payment of spectrum utilization fee—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by the user of the spectrum; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the method for determining which is prescribed under section 32I(2)(b),

subsection.continued: then the Authority may, in determining applications for the assignment, regard the fees, if any, arising or resulting from that method as a determining factor in relation to those applications. (Added 12 of 2001 s. 3)

subsection.content: Subject to the consultation requirement under section 32G(2), the Authority may by order designate the frequency bands in which the use of spectrum is subject to the payment of spectrum utilization fee by the users of the spectrum.

subsection.leadIn: The Secretary may by regulation prescribe—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the level of spectrum utilization fees; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the method for determining the spectrum utilization fees, which may be by—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: auction or tender or a combination of auction and tender; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: such method as the Secretary thinks fit, including any method combined with a method mentioned in subparagraph (i). (Replaced 12 of 2001 s. 4)

subsection.content: A spectrum utilization fee may be calculated on the basis of a royalty or any other basis that includes an element in excess of the simple recovery of the cost of providing a service by the Authority.

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to the generality of subsections (2) and (3), the power of the Secretary under subsection (2)(b) to make a regulation prescribing a method for determining spectrum utilization fee shall also include the power to make a regulation to provide for all or any of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: empowering the Secretary to specify the minimum fee of the spectrum utilization fee—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: by notice published in the Gazette or otherwise; and

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: a minimum fixed fee;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: a minimum fee determined by reference to a formula or percentage or the occurrence of an event or series of events;

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: a series of 2 or more minimum fees in relation to the same spectrum utilization fee where the relevant minimum fee is determined by reference to the occurrence of an event or series of events;

subparagraph.name: D
subparagraph.content: a minimum fee the determination of which varies upon the occurrence of an event or series of events;

subparagraph.name: E
subparagraph.content: a minimum fee determined by reference to another minimum fee, or by reference to the means of determining another minimum fee, whether or not the other minimum fee is or will become payable;

subparagraph.name: F
subparagraph.content: a minimum fee the determination of which varies with, or is calculated by reference to, the period of validity of a licence or any part thereof; or (Amended E.R. 1 of 2019)

subparagraph.name: G
subparagraph.content: any combination of 2 or more of any of the means specified in sub-subparagraph (A), (B), (C), (D), (E) or (F), whether in whole or in part;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: empowering the Authority to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: promote, hold, conduct, suspend, cancel or conclude an auction or tender to which the method relates;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: specify the terms and conditions of an auction or tender to which the method relates by notice published in the Gazette (including terms and conditions relating to the payment of the fee). (Added 12 of 2001 s. 4)

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to the generality of subsection (4)(b)(ii), the terms and conditions of an auction or tender which may be specified in a notice under that subsection may include terms and conditions relating to all or any of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to paragraph (c), the criteria by which the Authority shall determine whether a person is qualified to participate in the auction or tender;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subject to paragraph (c), the criteria by which the Authority shall determine whether 2 or more persons who are qualified by the criteria mentioned in paragraph (a) to participate in the auction or tender are connected, in whatever manner specified in the first-mentioned criteria, for the purposes of the auction or tender;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the criteria by which, or the procedure to be followed by which, the Authority shall determine which of the persons connected as mentioned in paragraph (b) is qualified to participate in the auction or tender;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a bidder or tenderer (including a prospective bidder or tenderer, or a person acting on behalf of a bidder or tenderer or prospective bidder or tenderer) shall lodge with, or otherwise provide to, the Authority security of such type and value as the Authority specifies, whether by notice published in the Gazette or otherwise (which value may be calculated by reference to a percentage of the minimum fee mentioned in subsection (4)(a));

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: that a bid or tender may not be withdrawn by the bidder or tenderer except with the consent in writing of the Authority and for a reason specified in the notice;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: that the Authority may disqualify a bid or tender, or a bidder or tenderer, for a reason specified in the notice;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.leadIn: that the Authority—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: may forfeit to the Government, or otherwise enforce, a security mentioned in paragraph (d) (including any interest earned thereon), whether in whole or in part, for a reason specified in the notice;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: subject to subsection (6), may cancel, withdraw or suspend a licence—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: where section 7(12) applied to the issue of the licence or section 32H(6) applied to the assignment under section 32H(1) of the spectrum to which the licence relates; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: for a reason specified in the notice;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: may specify requirements which have the purpose or effect of promoting or ensuring that the auction or tender is conducted in a fair, efficient and orderly manner. (Added 12 of 2001 s. 4)

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to the generality of any other ground on which the Authority may exercise the power mentioned in subsection (5)(g)(ii), the Authority shall not exercise that power pursuant to a complaint alleging that there is a ground for the exercise of the power except such a complaint made—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by a bidder or tenderer at the auction or tender to which the complaint relates; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to the Authority not later than 3 months after the date on which the outcome of that auction or tender was publicly declared. (Added 12 of 2001 s. 4)

subsection.content: Notwithstanding any other provision of this Ordinance, the Authority shall have all necessary powers to enforce the terms and conditions of an auction or tender which may be specified in a notice under subsection (4)(b)(ii). (Added 12 of 2001 s. 4)
Any spectrum utilization fee paid pursuant to this section shall be paid into the general revenue. (Added 12 of 2001 s. 4)

subsection.leadIn: It is declared that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a spectrum utilization fee payable pursuant to this section is a fee payable in addition to any fee prescribed under section 7(2) or 37(1)(g);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a complaint which would fall within subsection (6) but for the fact that it is made before the issue of the licence concerned, or before the assignment of the spectrum concerned, shall not of itself prevent the Authority from issuing the licence under section 7(5), or assigning the spectrum under section 32H(1), to the bidder or tenderer against which the complaint is made;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a notice mentioned in subsection (4)(a)(i) or (b)(ii) or (5)(d) is not subsidiary legislation. (Added 12 of 2001 s. 4)

subsection.content: A spectrum utilization fee (including any part thereof) owing to the Government shall be recoverable by the Government as a civil debt. (Added 12 of 2001 s. 4)

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to the generality of subsection (4)(a), in this section (including subsection (3))—
subsection.def: event (事件) includes a date;
spectrum utilization fee (頻譜使用費) includes a fixed fee, a fee calculated by a formula or a fee ascertained by another method, or any combination thereof. (Added 12 of 2001 s. 4)

subsection.content: A person shall not knowingly, and without lawful excuse, use an apparatus, whether or not it is an apparatus for telecommunications, in a manner that causes direct or indirect harmful interference with any telecommunications service lawfully carried on, or other apparatus for telecommunications lawfully operated, in or outside Hong Kong.

The Authority may, by notice in writing, direct a person possessing an apparatus, whether or not it is an apparatus for telecommunications, to take such measures as the Authority specifies and within the time directed to prevent the interference specified in the notice.

A person who contravenes subsection (1) or fails to comply with the direction in subsection (2) commits an offence and shall be liable on summary conviction to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

The Authority may, by order, specify the limits of conducted or radiated interference from any apparatus which is not subject to the licensing requirement under section 8, to prevent harmful interference with telecommunications networks, systems, installations or services.
The powers of the Authority under Part 5A extend to the apparatus mentioned in subsection (4). (Amended E.R. 2 of 2012)

The Authority may require an apparatus mentioned in subsection (4) to be submitted to the Authority for testing to verify whether the apparatus complies with the limits specified by the Authority under that subsection.

subsection.leadIn: A magistrate may, if he is satisfied by information on oath that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: access to premises, vessel, aircraft or vehicle has been requested; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: permission to examine or test any apparatus has been requested,

subsection.continued: and in either case has been unreasonably refused, issue a warrant empowering the Authority, or an authorized officer, to enter and search the premises, vehicle, aircraft or vessel specified in the warrant and to examine, test and confiscate any apparatus found on or in the premises, vehicle, aircraft or vessel.

section.name: s32K
section.heading: Examination, certification and authorization of operating personnel

subsection.content: The Authority may conduct an examination of the competence of a person in the operation of a particular class of apparatus for radiocommunications.

The Authority may issue a certificate of competency to a person whom it considers suitably qualified to certify that the person is competent in the operation of a particular class of apparatus for radiocommunications and may revoke the certificate issued if it considers that the person holding the certificate is no longer competent in the operation. (Amended 17 of 2011 s. 28)

A condition of a licence under this Ordinance may require that a particular radiocommunications station or a class of radiocommunications stations must be operated only by persons with the appropriate authority to operate issued by the Authority.

The Authority may issue an authority to operate to a person whom it considers fit to authorize that person to hold the position in a particular radiocommunications station or a class of radiocommunications stations. (Amended 17 of 2011 s. 28)

The Authority may suspend or revoke such an authority to operate issued if it considers the person holding the authority to operate is no longer fit to hold the position in the radiocommunications station or class of radiocommunications stations concerned. (Amended 17 of 2011 s. 28)

The Authority may by order provide for the examination of persons in connection with the operation of apparatus for radiocommunications, the issue and revocation of certificates of competency in the operation of apparatus for radiocommunications and the issue, suspension and revocation of authority to operate to hold positions in radiocommunications stations and the fees payable in respect of such examination, certification and authorization.

section.name: s32L
section.heading: Interpretation
section.def: appeal (上訴) means an appeal under section 32N(1) or (1D); (Amended 30 of 2003 s. 7; 14 of 2012 s. 176; 38 of 2021 s. 10)
Appeal Board (上訴委員會) means the Telecommunications Appeal Board established under section 32M(1); (Amended 38 of 2021 s. 10)
appeal subject matter (標的事項) means the subject of an appeal; (Replaced 38 of 2021 s. 10)
Chairman (主席) means the Chairman of the Appeal Board appointed under section 32M(2);
Deputy Chairman (副主席) means a Deputy Chairman of the Appeal Board appointed under section 32M(2);
panel member (備選委員) means a member of the panel of persons appointed under section 32M(5).

section.name: s32M
section.heading: Establishment and membership of Appeal Board

subsection.content: An appeal board is established with the name “Telecommunications Appeal Board” in English and “電訊上訴委員會” in Chinese. (Replaced 38 of 2021 s. 11)

Subject to subsections (3) and (4), the Chief Executive shall appoint a person to be the Chairman of the Appeal Board and such other persons as he thinks fit to be Deputy Chairmen of the Appeal Board.
A person shall not be appointed under subsection (2) unless the person is eligible to be appointed a judge of the High Court under section 9 of the High Court Ordinance (Cap. 4).
Subject to subsections (7) and (8), the Chairman and a Deputy Chairman shall each be appointed for a term of not more than 2 years but may be reappointed.
The Chief Executive shall appoint a panel of persons not being public officers whom he considers suitable for appointment under section 32O(1)(a)(ii) as members of the Appeal Board.
An appointment under subsection (2) or (5) shall be notified in the Gazette.
The Chairman, a Deputy Chairman or a panel member may at any time resign by notice in writing to the Chief Executive.

The Chief Executive may revoke the appointment of the Chairman, a Deputy Chairman or a panel member on the ground of incapacity, bankruptcy, neglect of duty or misconduct proved to the satisfaction of the Chief Executive.
The remuneration, if any, of the Chairman, a Deputy Chairman and a panel member shall be paid at a rate that the Financial Secretary determines.

subsection.leadIn: Any person aggrieved by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: an opinion, determination, direction or decision of the Authority relating to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: section 7Q; or (Amended 25 of 2012 s. 40)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any licence condition relating to that section; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any sanction or remedy imposed or to be imposed under this Ordinance by the Authority in consequence of a breach of that section or any such licence condition,

subsection.continued: may appeal to the Appeal Board against the opinion, determination, direction, decision, sanction or remedy, as the case may be, to the extent to which it relates to that section or any such licence condition, as the case may be. (Amended 14 of 2012 s. 176 and 18 of 2014 s. 175)

subsection.name: 1D
subsection.leadIn: Also, a person aggrieved by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a decision of the Authority to refuse to issue under section 7(5) a licence other than an exclusive licence;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a decision of the Authority to refuse to consent under section 7F(3) to the combining of telecommunications services;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a decision of the Authority to revoke under section 32K(2) a certificate of competency;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a decision of the Authority to suspend or revoke under section 32K(5) an authority to operate;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: a decision of the authority concerned to cancel, withdraw or suspend under section 34(4) a licence, permit, permission or consent;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: a determination of the Authority under section 36A(1) on the terms and conditions of interconnection;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: a direction by the Authority under section 36AA(1) to coordinate and cooperate;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: a direction by the Authority under section 36B(1);
a requirement by the Authority under section 36C(1) or (2) to pay a financial penalty; or

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: a requirement by the Authority under section 36C(3A) to disclose information or publish corrective advertisements,

subsection.continued: may appeal to the Appeal Board against the decision, determination, direction or requirement. (Added 38 of 2021 s. 12)

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (3), an appeal shall not suspend the operation of the appeal subject matter.

Where an appeal is made and the appeal subject matter falls within section 36C, then the appeal subject matter shall be suspended in its operation from the day on which the appeal is made until the appeal is determined, withdrawn or abandoned. (Amended 30 of 2003 s. 8; 14 of 2012 s. 176)

A person who wishes to make an appeal shall, not later than 14 days after he knows, or ought reasonably to have known, of the proposed appeal subject matter, lodge a notice of appeal with the Appeal Board.

section.name: s32O
section.heading: Procedure and powers of Appeal Board, etc.

subsection.leadIn: In the hearing of an appeal—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the Appeal Board shall consist of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the Chairman or a Deputy Chairman who shall preside at the hearing; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: 2 panel members appointed by the Chairman or Deputy Chairman;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: every question before the Appeal Board shall be determined by the opinion of the majority of the members hearing the appeal except a question of law which shall be determined by the Chairman or Deputy Chairman and in the case of an equality of votes the Chairman or Deputy Chairman shall have a casting vote;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any party shall be entitled to be heard either in person or through a counsel or solicitor, and if any party is a company, through any of its directors or other officers, or if a partnership, through any of its partners;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: subject to section 32P, the Appeal Board may—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: subject to subsection (2), receive and consider any material, whether by way of oral evidence, written statements, documents or otherwise, and whether or not it would be admissible in a court of law;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: by notice in writing signed by the Chairman or Deputy Chairman, summon any person—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: to produce to it any document that is relevant to the appeal and is in his custody or under his control;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: to appear before it and to give evidence relevant to the appeal;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: administer oaths and affirmations;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: require evidence to be given on oath or affirmation;

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: make an award of such sum, if any, in respect of the costs involved in the appeal as is just and equitable in all the circumstances of the case;

subparagraph.name: vi
subparagraph.content: where the Appeal Board is satisfied that it is just and equitable in all the circumstances of the case to do so, require a party to the appeal to pay the costs of the Appeal Board in hearing the appeal;

subparagraph.name: vii
subparagraph.content: make an order prohibiting a person from publishing or otherwise disclosing any material the Appeal Board receives;

subparagraph.name: viii
subparagraph.content: make an order prohibiting the publication or other disclosure of any material the Appeal Board receives at a sitting, or part of a sitting, which is held in private;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: if the term of appointment of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the Chairman or Deputy Chairman; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any panel member appointed under paragraph (a)(ii),

paragraph.continued: expires during the hearing, the Chairman, Deputy Chairman or panel member, as the case may be, may continue to hear the appeal until the appeal is determined.

subsection.content: Subsection (1)(d)(i) shall not entitle a person to require the Appeal Board to receive and consider any material which had not been submitted to or made available to the Authority or the authority concerned at any time before the opinion, determination, direction, decision, sanction, remedy or requirement referred to in section 32N(1) or (1D) was formed, made, imposed or to be imposed, as the case may be. (Amended 30 of 2003 s. 9; 14 of 2012 s. 176; 38 of 2021 s. 13)
Costs referred to in subsection (1)(d)(vi) are recoverable as a civil debt.
After hearing an appeal, the Appeal Board shall determine the appeal by upholding, varying or quashing the appeal subject matter and may make such consequential orders as may be necessary.
Every decision of the Appeal Board under subsection (4) shall be in writing and contain a statement of the reasons for its decision.

Every sitting of the Appeal Board shall be held in public unless the Appeal Board considers that in the interests of justice a sitting or part of a sitting should not be held in public in which case it may hold the sitting or part of the sitting in private.
The Chairman may determine any matter of practice or procedure relating to the hearing of appeals where no provision governing such matter is made in this Ordinance or in regulations made thereunder.

section.name: s32P
section.heading: Privilege against disclosure
section.content: The person making an appeal and the Authority (or the authority concerned) and, if different, any other person summoned under section 32O(1)(d)(ii) shall, for the purposes of the appeal, each have the same privileges in respect of the disclosure of any material as if the proceedings were proceedings before a court of law.

section.name: s32Q
section.heading: Appeal Board’s decision is final
section.content: Subject to section 32R, the determination of an appeal by the Appeal Board or any order as to costs made by the Appeal Board shall be final.

section.name: s32R
section.heading: Case may be stated for Court of Appeal

subsection.content: The Appeal Board may refer any question of law arising in an appeal to the Court of Appeal for determination by way of case stated.

subsection.leadIn: On the hearing of the case, the Court of Appeal may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: determine the question stated; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: remit the case to the Appeal Board, in whole or in part, for reconsideration in the light of the Court’s determination.

subsection.content: Where a case is stated under subsection (1), the Appeal Board shall not determine the relevant appeal before the Court of Appeal determines the relevant point of law.

subsection.leadIn: In relation to an appeal, any person who, without reasonable excuse, refuses or fails—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to attend and give evidence when required to do so by the Appeal Board;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to answer truthfully and completely questions put to him by the Appeal Board; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to produce any document which he is required by the Appeal Board to produce,

subsection.continued: commits an offence and is liable on summary conviction to a fine at level 4.

subsection.leadIn: Any person who publishes or otherwise discloses any material in contravention of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an order under section 32O(1)(d)(vii); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subject to subsection (3), an order under section 32O(1)(d)(viii),

subsection.continued: commits an offence and is liable on summary conviction to a fine at level 4.

subsection.content: It shall be a defence for a person charged with an offence under subsection (2)(b) to prove that he did not know and had no reason for knowing that the Appeal Board had made an order under section 32O(1)(d)(viii) prohibiting the publication or other disclosure of the material concerned.

The Chairman, a Deputy Chairman and a panel member have, in the performance of their duties under this Part, the same privileges and immunities as a judge of the Court of First Instance in civil proceedings in that court.
A witness before the Appeal Board shall be entitled to the same privileges and immunities as if he were a witness in civil proceedings in the Court of First Instance.

section.name: s32U
section.heading: Rules
section.leadIn: The Secretary for Commerce and Economic Development may make rules— (Amended L.N. 106 of 2002; L.N. 130 of 2007)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to provide for the lodging of appeals;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: relating to the practice and procedure of the Appeal Board.

editorialNote.content: For the saving and transitional provisions relating to the amendments made by the Resolution of the Legislative Council (L.N. 130 of 2007), see paragraph (12) of that Resolution.

section.name: s33
section.heading: Orders for interception of messages for provision of facilities

subsection.leadIn: For the purpose of providing or making available facilities reasonably required for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the detection or discovery of any telecommunications service provided in contravention of any provision of this Ordinance or any regulation made under this Ordinance or any of the terms or conditions of a licence granted under this Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the execution of prescribed authorizations for telecommunications interception that may from time to time be issued or renewed under the Interception of Communications and Surveillance Ordinance (Cap. 589),

subsection.continued: the Chief Executive may order that any class of messages shall be intercepted.

subsection.content: An order under subsection (1) shall not of itself authorize the obtaining of the contents of any individual message.

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.content: If an order has been made under subsection (1)(b), no investigation may be initiated in relation to any matter relating to the compliance with the order otherwise than pursuant to a request by the Chief Executive and in accordance with any conditions the Chief Executive may have imposed in the request. (Added 17 of 2011 s. 24)

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: contents (內容), in relation to any message, has the meaning assigned to it in section 2(6) of the Interception of Communications and Surveillance Ordinance (Cap. 589) in relation to a communication referred to in that section;
prescribed authorization (訂明授權) has the meaning assigned to it in section 2(1) of the Interception of Communications and Surveillance Ordinance (Cap. 589);
telecommunications interception (電訊截取) has the meaning assigned to it in section 2(1) of the Interception of Communications and Surveillance Ordinance (Cap. 589).

section.name: s34
section.heading: General provisions as to licences, etc.

subsection.name: 1A
