subsection.content: A licence granted under this Ordinance by the Chief Executive in Council may, with the consent in writing of the person to whom it was granted, be amended by order of the Chief Executive in Council. (Added 92 of 1970 s. 2. Amended 4 of 2024 s. 5)

subsection.name: 1B
subsection.content: Without affecting the generality of section 7(8) or 7A, a licence granted under this Ordinance may include a condition that the licensee shall procure, in favour of the Government, a first demand performance bond or bank guarantee, in such sum and in such form as the authority by whom the licence is granted may require, to secure the compliance by the licensee with any condition imposed under section 7(8) or 7A. (Added 38 of 1993 s. 6. Amended 36 of 2000 s. 18)

Any licence, permit, permission or consent granted under this Ordinance may at any time be cancelled or withdrawn by the authority by whom it was granted, or suspended by such authority for such period, not exceeding 12 months, as the authority specifies, in the event of any contravention by the licensee or the person to whom the permit, permission or consent was granted, as the case may be, of this Ordinance or of any condition to which the licence, permit, permission or consent is subject, and any such licence may be cancelled or suspended at any time by the Chief Executive in Council if he considers that the public interest so requires. (Amended 4 of 2024 s. 5)

subsection.name: 4A
subsection.content: The Authority shall not exercise a power under subsection (4) unless the exercise of the power is, in all the circumstances of the case, proportionate and reasonable in relation to the contravention concerned referred to in that subsection giving rise to the exercise of the power. (Added 36 of 2000 s. 18)

subsection.name: 4B
subsection.content: Where the Authority proposes to exercise a power under subsection (4), it shall give the licensee or other person concerned a reasonable opportunity to make representations and shall consider all representations made before it decides whether or not to exercise that power in the case of the licensee or other person, as the case may be. (Added 36 of 2000 s. 18. Amended 17 of 2011 s. 28)

subsection.name: 4C
subsection.content: Where the Authority exercises a power under subsection (4), it shall provide reasons in writing for the exercise of the power to the licensee or other person concerned. (Added 36 of 2000 s. 18. Amended 17 of 2011 s. 28)

subsection.name: 4D
subsection.leadIn: Where the Chief Executive in Council or the Authority proposes to exercise a power under subsection (4), the Chief Executive in Council or the Authority shall not consider— (Amended 17 of 2011 s. 28)

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: any representations mentioned in subsection (4B) to the extent to which they fall within paragraph (a);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the operation of subsection (5) if that power is exercised,

subsection.continued: and subsection (4A) shall be construed accordingly. (Added 12 of 2001 s. 5)

subsection.content: Where any licence, permit, permission or consent granted under this Ordinance is cancelled, withdrawn or suspended, no part of any fee or other sum paid in respect thereof or thereunder shall be refunded, including any spectrum utilization fee paid pursuant to section 32I. (Amended 12 of 2001 s. 5)

subsection.leadIn: Nothing in this section applies in respect of a licence—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: granted under Part 3A; or (Amended E.R. 2 of 2012)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: deemed to be granted under this Ordinance by virtue of Schedule 8 to the Broadcasting Ordinance (Cap. 562). (Replaced 48 of 2000 s. 44)

subsection.content: In the exercise of the power under subsection (4) by the relevant authority to cancel, withdraw or suspend a licence, permit, permission or consent granted under this Ordinance, the authority may cancel, withdraw or suspend (at such times and for such period as the authority determines) any part of the licence, permit, permission or consent without affecting the validity of the remaining part of the licence, permit, permission or consent. (Added 36 of 2000 s. 18)

subsection.leadIn: The Authority, or any public officer authorized in writing in that behalf by the Authority, may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: arrest any person whom the Authority or public officer reasonably suspects of being guilty of an offence under this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subject to subsection (2), enter and search any place, or board and search any vessel (other than a ship of war) or any aircraft (other than a military aircraft) or search any vehicle, in which the Authority or public officer reasonably suspects that there is anything liable to seizure under paragraph (c);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: seize, remove and detain—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: anything in respect of which the Authority or public officer reasonably suspects that an offence under this Ordinance has been committed;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: anything that appears to the Authority or public officer to be or to be likely to be, or to contain, evidence of an offence under this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: enter and inspect the premises at or from which any person manufactures, sells or otherwise deals in apparatus that may be used for telecommunications and require the production to the Authority or public officer of any books or documents relating to such apparatus. (Amended 36 of 2000 s. 28)

subsection.content: Where he is satisfied by information on oath that there is reasonable ground for suspecting that there is in any premises used for dwelling purposes anything that is liable to seizure under subsection (1)(c), a magistrate may issue his warrant authorizing such premises to be entered and searched by the Authority or any other public officer, and no premises used for dwelling purposes shall be entered or searched under this Ordinance except pursuant to the warrant of a magistrate issued under this subsection.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority or any public officer may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: break open any outer or inner door of any place that the Authority or public officer is empowered or authorized by or under this Ordinance to enter and search;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: forcibly board any vessel, aircraft or vehicle that the Authority or public officer is empowered by this Ordinance to board and search;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: remove by force any person or thing obstructing any arrest, detention, search, inspection, seizure or removal that the Authority or public officer is empowered by this Ordinance to make;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: detain any person found in any place that the Authority or public officer is empowered or authorized by or under this Ordinance to search until such place has been searched;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: detain any vessel or aircraft that the Authority or public officer is empowered by this Ordinance to board and search, and prevent any person from approaching or boarding such vessel or aircraft, until it has been searched;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: detain any vehicle that the Authority or public officer is empowered by the Ordinance to search until it has been searched.

section.name: s35A
section.heading: Inspection of records, documents and accounts

subsection.content: The Authority or a person whom it authorizes in writing may at all reasonable times enter the premises of a licensee and inspect and make copies of, or make or take an abstract of or extract from, a document or an account relating to a telecommunications network, system, installation or service conducted by the licensee for the purposes of the Authority performing its functions, or exercising its powers, under this Ordinance in order to ensure the licensee’s compliance with the provisions of this Ordinance, licence conditions, and the determinations and directions of the Authority, applicable to the licensee. (Amended 17 of 2011 s. 28)

The Authority or an authorized person in exercising the powers of the Authority or authorized person under this section may require a licensee to produce to the Authority or authorized person the document or account. (Amended 17 of 2011 s. 28)

To enable the Authority or an authorized person to exercise the powers of the Authority or authorized person under this section, a licensee shall give the Authority or authorized person access to the documents or accounts the Authority or authorized person may reasonably require for inspection, and shall produce to the Authority or authorized person the documents or accounts as the Authority or authorized person may reasonably require. (Amended 17 of 2011 s. 28)

A document or account includes information recorded by electronic or other means and the licensee’s requirement to provide access to documents and accounts includes a requirement to provide the appropriate system for reading and reducing the information into a written form on paper.

subsection.leadIn: Where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a copy of a document or an account is supplied by a person under this section; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a copy of a document or an account is made under this section, and a facility of a person other than the Authority is used to make the copy,

subsection.continued: the Authority shall reimburse the expenses which, in the opinion of the Authority, have been reasonably incurred by the person in making the copy.

subsection.content: A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (3) commits an offence and shall be liable on conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

A person who, without reasonable excuse, in purported compliance with a requirement made under this section, produces a document or an account, or gives information, which he knows to be false or misleading in a material particular commits an offence and shall be liable on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

The Authority shall not disclose any document or account produced under this section except subject to the requirement in subsection (9) and if the Authority considers that it is in the public interest to disclose that document or account, as the case may be.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority shall give a licensee producing any document or account under this section a reasonable opportunity to make representations on a proposed disclosure of the document or account, as the case may be, and shall consider all representations made before the Authority makes a final decision to disclose the document or account, as the case may be, if the Authority considers that the disclosure—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: would result in the release of information concerning the business, commercial or financial affairs of the licensee; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: could reasonably be expected to affect adversely the licensee’s lawful business, commercial or financial affairs.

subsection.content: For the avoidance of doubt, it is hereby declared that where a person produces a document or account under this section notwithstanding that the document or account is the subject of a confidentiality agreement with another person that prevents the first-mentioned person from releasing the document or account, the first-mentioned person shall not be liable for any civil liability or claim whatever in respect of the production of that document or account, as the case may be, contrary to that agreement.
Nothing in this section shall require a person to produce any document or account which the person could not be compelled to produce in civil proceedings before the Court of First Instance.
The Authority may require that one or more fixed carrier licensees have a universal service obligation.

A universal service obligation requires a licensee to ensure that a good, efficient and continuous basic service is, in the Authority’s opinion, reasonably available to all persons within the areas of Hong Kong covered by that obligation.

The Authority may establish a system for licensees prescribed by the Authority to meet a reasonable contribution to the cost of providing the universal service obligation and managing the fund established under subsection (4).
The Authority may establish and manage a fund for the purpose of holding the contributions under subsection (3) prior to payment to the carrier licensee with the obligation.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: recover the cost of the management of the fund established under subsection (4);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: delegate the management of the fund to any person and prescribe the requirements for the management of the fund.

section.name: s36
section.heading: Forfeiture
section.content: A magistrate or the court may, upon application by or on behalf of the Authority or by any public officer, order that any apparatus in respect of which there has been a contravention or attempted contravention of this Ordinance must be forfeited to the Government, whether or not proceedings have been taken against any person in respect of the contravention or attempted contravention.

section.name: s36A
section.heading: Authority may determine terms of interconnection

subsection.content: The Authority may determine the terms and conditions of interconnection of the type mentioned in subsection (3D). (Replaced 36 of 2000 s. 20)

The Authority may make a determination on the request of a party to the interconnection or, in the absence of a request, if it considers it is in the interest of the public to do so. (Replaced 36 of 2000 s. 20. Amended 17 of 2011 s. 28)
The terms and conditions in a determination may include any technical, commercial and financial terms and conditions that the Authority considers fair and reasonable. (Replaced 36 of 2000 s. 20)

subsection.name: 3A
subsection.leadIn: Without limiting the general nature of subsection (3), the terms and conditions in a determination may include—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the level of, and the method of calculating, the charges that any party will pay to another;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the points at which interconnection is to be made;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the technical standards for interconnection;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the supply by any party to another of any element of a telecommunications network, system or installation;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the supply by any party to another of any telecommunications or ancillary service;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the supply by any party to another of any information necessary for the efficient planning and handling of services through the interconnection;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the sharing of facilities referred to in section 36AA. (Added 36 of 2000 s. 20)

subsection.name: 3B
subsection.content: The charges in a determination shall be based on the relevant reasonable costs attributable to interconnection and, in determining the level, or method of calculation, of the relevant reasonable costs attributable to interconnection, the Authority may select from among alternative costing methods what it considers to be a fair and reasonable costing method. (Added 36 of 2000 s. 20. Amended 17 of 2011 s. 28)

subsection.name: 3C
subsection.leadIn: The terms and conditions in a determination—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: are deemed to be of the essence of any agreement for the interconnection to which the determination is made unless the Authority otherwise directs for any particular term or condition; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: override a different intention arising from the provisions of the agreement. (Added 36 of 2000 s. 20)

subsection.name: 3D
subsection.leadIn: The type of interconnection includes an arrangement among 2 or more parties for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: interconnection to and between telecommunications systems or services including—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: those licensed under section 7, or expressed as being licensed under section 7 or 34; (Amended 23 of 2020 s. 13)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: those of a description mentioned in section 8(4)(e) and (f);

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: telecommunications services that are the subject of an order made under section 39;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: access to, or interconnection with, any element of a telecommunications network, system, installation or service on an unbundled basis at any point that is technically feasible;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the supply of a telecommunications service in connection with paragraph (a) or (b). (Added 36 of 2000 s. 20)

subsection.name: 3E
subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: element (元件) means any cable, component, unit, equipment, hardware or software used to provide a telecommunications service and includes the facilities referred to in section 36AA;

interconnection (互連) means any connection between systems or services or elements of systems or services for the delivery of any communication, message or signal over the connection and, without limiting the generality of the foregoing, includes interconnection to a system, to a service, between systems, between services and between a system and a service;
service (服務) includes elements of a service;
system (系統) includes elements of a system. (Added 36 of 2000 s. 20)

subsection.content: No determination shall be made under subsection (1) unless the Authority is satisfied that the parties to any arrangement for interconnection of the type mentioned in subsection (3D) have been afforded reasonable opportunity to make representations to it as to why a determination should not be made and the Authority has considered representations made before it decides whether or not to make such a determination. (Amended 36 of 2000 s. 20; 17 of 2011 s. 28)

Written notice of a determination, or of the completion or adjournment of a determination process commenced, under subsection (1) shall be served personally or by registered post on the parties to the arrangement for interconnection or, in the absence of a concluded arrangement, the parties who in the Authority’s opinion would have been parties to the interconnection arrangement had it been concluded. (Replaced 36 of 2000 s. 20)

subsection.name: 5A
subsection.content: Subject to subsection (5B), parties to an interconnection agreement shall ensure a copy of the agreement is filed with the Authority within 14 days of it being made. (Added 36 of 2000 s. 20)

subsection.name: 5B
subsection.content: The obligation to file a copy of an interconnection agreement under subsection (5A) may be waived by the Authority in relation to a particular interconnection agreement or interconnection agreements of a certain kind. (Added 36 of 2000 s. 20)

subsection.name: 5C
subsection.leadIn: The Authority may publish all or any part of an interconnection agreement if it— (Amended 17 of 2011 s. 28)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: considers it is in the interest of the public to do so;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has first given the parties an opportunity to make representations on which parts of the interconnection agreement should not be published; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: has considered such representations received within the time specified by it. (Added 36 of 2000 s. 20. Amended 17 of 2011 s. 28)

subsection.name: 5D
subsection.content: A determination takes effect even though it is under review unless stayed by a court of competent jurisdiction. (Added 36 of 2000 s. 20)

The amount of any costs or expenses incurred, including, without limitation, staff costs and expenses, and the financing of liabilities paid out of the Office of the Communications Authority Trading Fund in respect of a determination or determination process under subsection (1) is a debt due to the Government, and is on service of a notice under subsection (5), recoverable from a person on whom notice has been served. (Replaced 36 of 2000 s. 20. Amended 17 of 2011 s. 28)

It shall be a defence for any person against whom an action is brought under subsection (6) to satisfy the District Court that he or it concurred with the substance of the terms and conditions as manifested in the determination and had given notice in writing of that fact to the Authority not less than 30 days before the service on him or it of a notice under subsection (5).

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may, after consultation with the parties to an interconnection agreement, issue codes of practice—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: relating to the efficient and reliable provision of interconnection; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: which shall be observed by the parties. (Added 36 of 2000 s. 20)

subsection.leadIn: In making a determination under subsection (1), the Authority shall give regard to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Government’s policy objectives for the telecommunications industry;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: consumer interests;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: encouraging efficient investment in telecommunications infrastructure;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the nature and extent of competition among the parties to the interconnection concerned and their respective abilities to compete with each other fairly; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: such other matters as the Authority considers appropriate in the particular circumstances of the case. (Added 36 of 2000 s. 20)

subsection.content: The Authority may direct a licensee to coordinate and cooperate with another licensee specified by the Authority in the public interest to share the use of any facility owned or used by it.

Prior to issuing a direction in the public interest under subsection (1), the Authority shall provide a reasonable opportunity for the licensee, and any other interested party, to make representations on the matter and shall give consideration to all representations made before it decides whether or not to issue the direction. (Amended 17 of 2011 s. 28)

subsection.leadIn: In considering a direction in the public interest to share a facility, the Authority shall take into account relevant matters including, but not limited to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whether the facility is a bottleneck facility;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: whether the facility can be reasonably duplicated or substituted;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the existence of technical alternatives;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: whether the facility is critical to the supply of service by the licensees;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: whether the facility has available capacity having regard to the current and reasonable future needs of the licensee or person to whom the facility belongs;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: whether joint use of the facility encourages the effective and efficient use of telecommunications infrastructure;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the costs, time, penalties and inconvenience to the licensees and the public of the alternatives to shared provision and use of the facility.

subsection.content: Where another licensee reasonably requests to share a facility, the licensee shall endeavour to come to an agreement with the requesting party on the conditions, including but not limited to providing for fair compensation to the licensee for the provision, use or sharing of the facility.
A shared facility may include a building, place or premises that is exclusively occupied and operated by one of the parties to the sharing agreement.

subsection.leadIn: If the parties do not reach an agreement within a reasonable time, and the Authority requires shared use of the facility, then—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Authority may determine the terms and conditions for the shared use of the facility;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the determination under paragraph (a) shall include terms and conditions providing for fair and reasonable compensation payable in all the circumstances of the case for the shared use of the facility;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the compensation referred to in paragraph (b) shall include the relevant reasonable costs attributable to the provision, use or sharing of the facility;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: to calculate the costs referred to in paragraph (c), the Authority may select from alternative costing methods what it considers to be a fair and reasonable costing method. (Amended 17 of 2011 s. 28)

def.name: Facility
def.leadIn: For the purposes of this section facility (設施) includes—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a cable, wire, telecommunications line, duct, pit, tunnel and manhole;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a tower, mast, pole and antenna;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: land, buildings and ancillary equipment at sites on which radiocommunications facilities have been established;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: reasonable space within a carrier licensee’s exchange buildings or other sites to locate equipment of another licensee required to establish interconnection between the licensee’s and that other licensee’s network at the exchange or sites;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: other installations, including but not limited to in-building risers, cable trays and cable entry points into buildings, reasonably necessary for the efficient provision of a telecommunications network; and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: services incidental to the building, place and premises in which the facility is situated that are reasonably necessary or incidental to the efficient operation by all parties to the sharing of the facility.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2), the Authority may issue directions in writing—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: to a licensee requiring it to take such action as the Authority considers necessary in order for the licensee to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: comply with any of the terms or conditions of its licence; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: comply with any provision of this Ordinance or any regulation made thereunder; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.leadIn: in relation to any interconnection of the type mentioned in section 36A(3D), secure the connection of any telecommunications service being the subject of its licence to— (Amended 36 of 2000 ss. 22 & 28)

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: any other telecommunications service being the subject of a licence granted under this Ordinance or of an order made under section 39; or (Amended 36 of 2000 s. 28)

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: a system of the description mentioned in section 8(4)(e); or

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: a closed circuit television system of the description mentioned in section 8(4)(f); and (Amended 40 of 1995 s. 9)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: to any person being the operator of—

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: a closed circuit television system of the description mentioned in section 8(4)(f); or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: a telecommunications service being the subject of an order under section 39, (Amended 36 of 2000 s. 28)

paragraph.continued: requiring that person to take such action as the Authority considers necessary in order to secure, in relation to any interconnection of the type mentioned in section 36A(3D), the connection of any such system, closed circuit television system or telecommunications service to— (Amended 36 of 2000 ss. 22 & 28)

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: any telecommunications service provided by a licensee under this Ordinance; or (Amended 36 of 2000 s. 28)

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: any other system of the description mentioned in section 8(4)(e); or

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: any other closed circuit television system of the description mentioned in section 8(4)(f); or

subparagraph.name: D
subparagraph.content: any other telecommunications service being the subject of an order made under section 39, (Amended 40 of 1995 s. 9; 36 of 2000 s. 28)

subsection.continued: and the licensee or such person shall give effect to such direction.

subsection.content: No direction shall be so issued under subsection (1)(a)(iii) or (b), unless the Authority is satisfied that the licensee or such person has been afforded reasonable opportunity to make representations to the Authority.

section.name: s36C
section.heading: Authority or court may impose financial penalties

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may, by notice in writing addressed to a licensee, require the licensee to pay to the Government the financial penalty specified in such notice in any case where the licensee fails to comply with—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any licence condition;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any provision of this Ordinance or any regulation made thereunder; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any direction issued in respect of the licensee by the Authority under section 36AA(1) or 36B(1)(a). (Amended 36 of 2000 s. 23)

subsection.content: The Authority may, by notice in writing to any person of the description mentioned in section 36B(1)(b), require that person to pay to the Government the financial penalty specified in such notice in any case where that person fails to comply with the requirement of any direction issued in respect of that person by the Authority under that section. (Amended 36 of 2000 s. 23)

subsection.leadIn: A financial penalty imposed under subsection (1) or (2) shall not exceed—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: $200,000 for the first occasion on which a penalty is so imposed;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: $500,000 for the second occasion on which a penalty is so imposed; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: $1,000,000 for any subsequent occasion on which a penalty is so imposed. (Amended 36 of 2000 s. 23)

subsection.name: 3A
subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to subsections (3) and (3B), the Authority may, by notice to a licensee who has committed a breach of a licence condition or provision in this Ordinance or regulation made thereunder, or a breach of a direction, require the licensee—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to disclose to the public, to a particular person or to a class of persons, in such manner as is specified in the notice, such information, or information of such a kind, as is so specified, being information that relates to the breach and is in the possession of the licensee or to which the licensee has access;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to publish, at its own expense, in newspapers corrective advertisements in such manner, at such times and on such terms as are specified in the notice and for this purpose, the Authority may specify among other things the newspapers in which the advertisements shall be published, the languages that shall be used, the days on which the advertisements shall be published, the content of the advertisements and the size and prominence of the advertisements in the newspapers. (Added 36 of 2000 s. 23)

subsection.name: 3B
subsection.leadIn: Where the Authority considers that if it were to impose a financial penalty under subsection (3) it would not be adequate for a breach referred to in subsection (1)— (Amended 17 of 2011 s. 28)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the Authority may—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: within 3 years of the commission of the breach; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if the breach comes to the notice of the Authority within 3 years of its commission, within 3 years of it so coming to the notice of the Authority,

paragraph.continued: whichever is the later, make an application to the Court of First Instance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: upon such application, the Court of First Instance may, without prejudice to any powers conferred on the Authority by any provision of this Ordinance or any regulation made thereunder or any licence condition, impose upon the licensee who has committed the breach a financial penalty of a sum not exceeding 10% of the turnover of the licensee in the relevant telecommunications market in the period of the breach, or $10,000,000, whichever is the higher. (Added 36 of 2000 s. 23)

subsection.content: The Authority shall not impose a financial penalty under this section unless, in all the circumstances of the case, the financial penalty is proportionate and reasonable in relation to the failure or series of failures concerned giving rise to that penalty. (Replaced 36 of 2000 s. 23)

Subsection (1), (2) or (3A) shall not apply in the case of the licensee or person concerned unless the Authority is satisfied that the licensee or person, as the case may be, has been afforded a reasonable opportunity of complying with the requirement of any licence condition, provision of this Ordinance or regulation made thereunder, or direction, in respect of which that subsection is sought to be applied. (Replaced 36 of 2000 s. 23)

subsection.name: 5A
subsection.content: A financial penalty imposed under this section shall be recoverable as a civil debt due and payable to the Government. (Added 36 of 2000 s. 23)
The imposition of a financial penalty under this section, in relation to a licence, shall not be construed as affecting the application of section 34(4).

The Authority shall, before imposing a sanction under this section on a licensee or person concerned, afford the licensee or person concerned, as the case may be, a reasonable opportunity to make representations and shall consider all representations made before the Authority decides whether or not to impose such sanction. (Added 36 of 2000 s. 23)

subsection.leadIn: If the Authority is satisfied that there are reasonable grounds for believing that a person, other than a licensee, is, or is likely to be, in possession of information or a document that is relevant to the Authority’s investigation of a breach or suspected breach of a provision of this Ordinance, or of a determination or direction of the Authority or of a licence condition, the Authority may serve a notice in writing on the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: requesting the person to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: give the information or document in writing to the Authority; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: produce the document to the Authority,

paragraph.continued: as the case requires, before a date (the relevant date) specified in the notice, being a date reasonable in all the circumstances of the case;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: stating that if the person is of the view that he cannot, or does not wish to, comply with the request, then he may make representations in writing to the Authority as to why he is of that view before the relevant date; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: accompanied by a copy of this section in the Chinese and English languages.

subsection.leadIn: Where the Authority receives representations referred to in subsection (1)(b) from a person, the Authority shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: consider them; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: serve a notice in writing on the person stating that the Authority has considered the representations and that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the notice under subsection (1) served on the person is withdrawn with effect from the date of service of the notice under this subsection; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the notice under subsection (1) served on the person remains in force and the Authority will on a date specified in the notice under this subsection seek an order under subsection (3) unless the person has, before that date, complied with the notice under subsection (1) served on the person.

subsection.leadIn: Where a notice under subsection (1) served on a person has not been withdrawn under subsection (2)(b)(i) and the person has not complied with the notice before the relevant date, or before the date specified in the notice under subsection (2) served on the person, as the case requires, then a magistrate may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if satisfied by information on oath that there are reasonable grounds for believing that the person is, or is likely to be, in possession of the information or a document to which the first-mentioned notice relates and that the information or document is relevant to the Authority’s investigation of a breach or suspected breach of a provision of this Ordinance, or of a determination or direction of the Authority or of a licence condition; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: after considering the representations, if any, referred to in subsection (1)(b) received by the Authority in consequence of the service of the notice,

subsection.continued: issue an order that the person shall, within the time specified in the order, give the information or document in writing to the Authority or produce the document to the Authority, as the case requires.

subsection.leadIn: Any information or document to be given or produced to the Authority by a person in compliance with a notice under subsection (1) or an order under subsection (3) shall be so given or produced by reference to the information or document at the time of service of that notice except that the information or document may take account of any processing—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: made between that time and the time when the information or document is so given or produced; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that would have been made irrespective of the service of that notice.

subsection.content: The Authority shall not disclose any information or document given or produced to it under this section except subject to the requirement in subsection (6) and if the Authority considers that it is in the public interest to disclose that information or document, as the case may be. (Amended 17 of 2011 s. 28)

The Authority shall give a person giving or producing any information or document under this section a reasonable opportunity to make representations on a proposed disclosure of the information or document, as the case may be, and shall consider all representations made before the Authority makes a final decision to disclose the information or document, as the case may be.

For the avoidance of doubt, it is hereby declared that where a person gives or produces any information or document under this section notwithstanding that the information or document is the subject of a confidentiality agreement with another person that prevents the first-mentioned person from releasing the information or document, the first-mentioned person shall not be liable for any civil liability or claim whatever in respect of the giving or production of that information or document, as the case may be, contrary to that agreement.

Nothing in this section shall require a person to give any information or document, or to produce any document, which the person could not be compelled to give in evidence, or produce, in civil proceedings before the Court of First Instance.

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if he, without reasonable excuse—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: fails to comply with an order under subsection (3);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: fails to comply with subsection (4); or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in purported compliance with a notice under subsection (1) or an order under subsection (3), knowingly gives information that is false or misleading,

subsection.continued: and shall be liable on conviction to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 2 years.

subsection.def: In this section, processing (處理), in relation to any information or document, includes amending, augmenting, deleting or rearranging all or any part of the information or document, whether by automated means or otherwise.

subsection.leadIn: The Chief Executive in Council may by regulation provide for— (Amended 4 of 2024 s. 5)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the control and conduct of means of telecommunications; (Amended 36 of 2000 s. 28)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the operation and use of apparatus for telecommunications or apparatus that generates and emits radio waves; (Amended 36 of 2000 s. 28)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the prohibition and control of electrical or radiated interference with the working of apparatus for telecommunications; (Amended 36 of 2000 s. 28)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the conditions and restrictions subject to which messages may be transmitted or received;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the period for which, and the conditions subject to which, messages and other documents connected with a telecommunications service must be preserved; (Amended 36 of 2000 s. 28; 4 of 2024 s. 9)

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: fees for searching for messages or other documents connected with a telecommunications service; (Amended 36 of 2000 s. 28)

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the licences and permits that may be granted by the Authority and the fees payable on the grant or renewal of any such licences or permits;

paragraph.name: ga
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to a licence granted under this Ordinance by the Chief Executive in Council— (Amended 4 of 2024 s. 5)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the control to be exercised over; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the beneficial ownership or control of any of the voting shares in,

paragraph.continued: the licensee by any other person; (Added 38 of 1993 s. 8)

paragraph.name: gb
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to a licence, permit, permission or consent granted under this Ordinance by the Authority—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the control to be exercised over; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the beneficial ownership or control of any of the voting shares in,

paragraph.continued: the licensee by any other person. (Added 38 of 1993 s. 8. Amended E.R. 1 of 2019)

content.leadIn: Regulations made under this section may provide that contravention of specified provisions of such regulations shall be an offence and may provide penalties therefor:
content.proviso: Provided that no penalty so provided shall exceed a fine at level 4 and imprisonment for 12 months. (Amended 18 of 1994 s. 15)

subsection.leadIn: Regulations made under paragraph (c) of subsection (1) may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: constitute the Authority as the sole authority for the making of tests and measurements in respect of electrical or radiated interference;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: confer upon the Authority the power to determine the measuring apparatus to be used, the method by which and the conditions under which tests are to be made and the manner to be used in computing the amount of any such interference from readings afforded by the measuring apparatus;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in respect of any specified class or classes of apparatus confer upon the Authority, with or without restriction, the power to fix, in such manner as may be specified in the regulations, the limits of any such interference at any frequency or within any frequency range, whether in substitution for or by way of amendment of limits, frequencies or frequency ranges specified in any regulations made under that paragraph, or otherwise; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: provide for the issue by magistrates of warrants empowering the Authority, or any public officer authorized in writing in that behalf by the Authority, to enter and search any premises, vessel, aircraft or vehicle and to examine and test any apparatus found thereon or therein in cases where access to such premises, vessel, aircraft or vehicle has been demanded, or permission to examine or test any such apparatus has been requested, but in either case has been unreasonably refused. (Added 26 of 1966 s. 3)

subsection.def: For the purposes of regulations made under subsection (1)(ga) or (gb), voting shares (有表決權股份) means shares in the licensee which entitle the registered owner of such shares to vote at meetings of shareholders of the licensee. (Added 38 of 1993 s. 8)

subsection.content: The Chief Executive in Council may by order exempt any person or any class of persons from this Ordinance or from such of the provisions thereof as he thinks fit. (Amended 4 of 2024 s. 5)

Without derogation from the provisions of section 40 of the Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance (Cap. 1) an order under this section may provide that it shall be a condition of any exemption granted thereunder that the person or class of persons to whom it is granted shall not directly or indirectly fix, levy or make payable, any charge for any service, facility or circuit in respect of which the exemption is made greater than such charge as may, from time to time, be specified by the Authority by order in the Gazette. (Added 69 of 1983 s. 6. Amended 36 of 2000 s. 28)

A person sustaining loss or damage from a breach of section 7Q, or a breach of a licence condition, determination or direction relating to that section, may bring an action for damages, an injunction or other appropriate remedy, order or relief against the person who is in breach. (Amended 14 of 2012 s. 176 and 18 of 2014 s. 175; 25 of 2012 s. 41)

subsection.leadIn: No action may be brought under subsection (1) more than 3 years after—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the commission of the breach concerned referred to in that subsection; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the imposition of a penalty in relation to the breach by the Authority under section 36C, or, as the case may be, by the Court of First Instance under section 36C(3B),

subsection.continued: whichever is the later.

subsection.content: Any telecommunications line or post lawfully placed and maintained in, over or upon any land under the repealed Telecommunication Ordinance (18 of 1936) at the commencement* of this Ordinance shall be deemed to be placed and maintained in, over or upon the said land under and in accordance with this Ordinance. (Amended 36 of 2000 s. 28)

section.name: s41
section.heading: Validation
section.content: For the avoidance of doubt, it is declared that where at any time before the commencement* of the Telecommunication (Amendment) Ordinance 1982 (57 of 1982) the Telecommunications Authority granted any licence in purported exercise of its powers under section 7 relating to a broadcast relay station or closed circuit television, such grant shall not be invalid by reason only that any such licence was not at that time a licence specified in the second column of Schedule 1 to the Telecommunications Regulations (Cap. 106 sub. leg. A).

section.name: s42
section.heading: Transitional
section.content: In a licence issued, granted or renewed under this Ordinance before the commencement date* of the Communications Authority Ordinance (Cap. 616), any condition providing for the payment of the licence fee to the Government is to be construed as a condition providing for the payment of the licence fee to the Authority.

section.name: s43
section.heading: Transitional provisions—Trade Descriptions (Unfair Trade Practices) (Amendment) Ordinance 2012

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: Appeal Board (上訴委員會) has the meaning given by section 32L of the pre-amended Ordinance;
appeal subject matter (標的事項) has the meaning given by section 32L of the pre-amended Ordinance;
*commencement date (生效日期) means the date on which Division 2 of Part 5 of the amending Ordinance comes into operation;
pre-amended Ordinance (《原有條例》) means this Ordinance as in force immediately before the commencement date.

subsection.leadIn: Any conduct of a licensee that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: was engaged in, or was in part engaged in, before the commencement date; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: but for the enactment of the amending Ordinance would be covered by section 7M of the pre-amended Ordinance,

subsection.continued: may be investigated under this Ordinance on or after the commencement date, and the provisions of this Ordinance apply in relation to that investigation as if the amending Ordinance had not been enacted.

subsection.content: Any investigation of any conduct referred to in subsection (2) initiated before the commencement date under the pre-amended Ordinance may be continued under this Ordinance on or after the commencement date, and the provisions of this Ordinance apply in relation to that investigation as if the amending Ordinance had not been enacted.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: but for the enactment of the amending Ordinance a person may make an appeal to the Appeal Board under section 32N(1) of the pre-amended Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the appeal subject matter relates to section 7M of that Ordinance,

subsection.continued: the appeal may be made to and disposed of by the Appeal Board under this Ordinance on or after the commencement date, and the provisions of this Ordinance apply in relation to that appeal as if the amending Ordinance had not been enacted.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an appeal made to the Appeal Board under section 32N(1) of the pre-amended Ordinance has not been finally determined before the commencement date; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the appeal subject matter relates to section 7M of that Ordinance,

subsection.continued: the appeal may be continued and disposed of by the Appeal Board under this Ordinance on or after the commencement date, and the provisions of this Ordinance apply in relation to that appeal as if the amending Ordinance had not been enacted.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.leadIn: the action relates to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a breach of section 7M of the pre-amended Ordinance; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a breach of a licence condition, determination or direction relating to section 7M of the pre-amended Ordinance,

subsection.continued: the action may be brought under this Ordinance on or after the commencement date as if the amending Ordinance had not been enacted.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.leadIn: the action relates to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a breach of section 7M of that Ordinance; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a breach of a licence condition, determination or direction relating to section 7M of that Ordinance,

subsection.continued: the action may be continued under this Ordinance on or after the commencement date as if the amending Ordinance had not been enacted.

section.name: s44
section.heading: Transitional and savings provisions—Broadcasting and Telecommunications Legislation (Amendment) Ordinance 2020
section.content: Schedule 4 sets out the transitional and savings provisions relating to the Broadcasting and Telecommunications Legislation (Amendment) Ordinance 2020 (23 of 2020).

subsection.leadIn: An act or thing that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has been done before the commencement date in the exercise of a power, or performance of a function or duty, by the former Appeal Board under the pre-amended Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is in force immediately before the commencement date,

subsection.continued: continues to be in force on or after the commencement date as if the 2021 Amending Ordinance had not been enacted.

subsection.content: An appeal that is pending immediately before the commencement date is to be dealt with by the new Appeal Board under this Ordinance as amended by the 2021 Amending Ordinance on or after the commencement date.
Section 32N(1D) applies only in relation to a decision, determination or requirement made, or a direction issued, on or after the commencement date.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: 2021 Amending Ordinance (《2021年修訂條例》) means the Telecommunications (Amendment) Ordinance 2021 (38 of 2021);
new Appeal Board (新上訴委員會) means the Appeal Board as defined by section 32L as amended by the 2021 Amending Ordinance;
pre-amended Ordinance (《原有條例》) means this Ordinance as in force immediately before the commencement date.

section.name: s1
section.heading: Interpretation
section.def: Amendment Ordinance (《修訂條例》) means the Broadcasting and Telecommunications Legislation (Amendment) Ordinance 2020 (23 of 2020);
*commencement date (生效日期) means the day on which the Amendment Ordinance comes into operation;
licence (牌照) has the meaning given by section 13A(1);
licensee (持牌人) has the meaning given by section 13A(1).

section.name: s2
section.heading: Act or thing previously done by Chief Executive in Council or Authority

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has been done before the commencement date in the exercise of a power or performance of a function or duty by the Chief Executive in Council or the Authority under this Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is in force immediately before the commencement date,

section.continued: continues to be in force on or after the commencement date as if the Amendment Ordinance had not been enacted.

subsection.leadIn: An inquiry or investigation that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has been started before the commencement date by the Authority under this Ordinance or the Broadcasting (Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 391); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has not been determined, concluded or otherwise disposed of immediately before the commencement date,

subsection.continued: may continue on or after the commencement date as if the Amendment Ordinance had not been enacted.

subsection.leadIn: A right of appeal under section 26 of the Broadcasting (Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 391) that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subsists immediately before the commencement date; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: concerns a decision or direction in relation to an act or omission that occurred before the commencement date,

subsection.continued: continues to subsist on or after the commencement date as if the Amendment Ordinance had not been enacted.

subsection.content: An appeal under section 26 of the Broadcasting (Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 391) that is pending immediately before the commencement date may be continued and disposed of on or after the commencement date as if the Amendment Ordinance had not been enacted.

This Ordinance applies to a non-compliance or suspected non-compliance with a provision of this Ordinance, a direction, order or determination under this Ordinance or a licence condition, that occurred before the commencement date as if the Amendment Ordinance had not been enacted, even if the act or omission constituting the non-compliance or suspected non-compliance is only discovered on or after the commencement date.

subsection.leadIn: However, if the act or omission—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: continues on or after the commencement date; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: no longer constitutes such a non-compliance or suspected non-compliance under this Ordinance as amended by the Amendment Ordinance,

subsection.continued: this Ordinance applies only to the non-compliance or suspected non-compliance that occurred before the commencement date and as if the Amendment Ordinance had not been enacted.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an application has been made before the commencement date to the Authority under section 13B(1);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Authority is satisfied as to the matters set out in section 13B(2); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the application has not been determined immediately before the commencement date,

subsection.continued: the application is to be dealt with under this Ordinance as amended by the Amendment Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: If, before the commencement date, the Authority has made recommendations on the application under section 13C(1), the Chief Executive in Council may on or after the commencement date—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: rely on the recommendations for the purposes of section 13C(1) and (2); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: request the Authority to—

subparagraph.content: reconsider the application; and
make fresh recommendations.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Pending application for renewal of licence

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: before the commencement date, a licensee, in accordance with the terms and conditions of a licence, has indicated interest in the licence being renewed; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: renewal of the licence and the terms and conditions to be imposed have not been determined under section 13E(2) immediately before the commencement date,

subsection.continued: renewal of the licence is to be dealt with under this Ordinance as amended by the Amendment Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: If, before the commencement date, the Authority has submitted recommendations concerning the renewal of the licence and the terms and conditions to be imposed under section 13E(1), the Chief Executive in Council may on or after the commencement date—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: rely on the recommendations for the purposes of section 13E(1) and (2); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: request the Authority to submit fresh recommendations.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Pending application for permission or extension

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an application has been made before the commencement date to seek permission from the Chief Executive in Council under section 13H(2), or to seek an extension or a further extension from the Authority under section 13K(2); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the application is pending immediately before the commencement date.

subsection.content: The application is to be dealt with under this Ordinance as amended by the Amendment Ordinance.

However, if the application or part of the application would not be necessary under this Ordinance as amended by the Amendment Ordinance, the application or the part is taken to have been withdrawn on the commencement date.
